( a) Comparison of temperature anomaly records of the East (blue) and West Antarctica (red). Thick solid curves represent corresponding 11-year running average. ( b) Cross wavelet analysis of the two times series of the East and West Antarctic temperature records. The red color band highlights the common highest power in these two times series. ( c, d) Scale-averaged wavelet power over the 2–8, 16–32, 32–64 yr band which is a measure of the average variance with time
22 . Three curves (red, blue and light gray) represent average variance of the East and West Antarctic temperature at three different frequency bands: 2–8, 16–32 and 32–64 years.
